author: Imam Muslim
description: The second most authentic collection of hadiths compiled by Imam Muslim ibn al-Hajjaj

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 1: The Book of Faith
hadiths.textArabic: بَيْنَمَا نَحْنُ عِنْدَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ ذَاتَ يَوْمٍ إِذْ طَلَعَ عَلَيْنَا رَجُلٌ شَدِيدُ بَيَاضِ الثِّيَابِ شَدِيدُ سَوَادِ الشَّعْرِ لَا يُرَى عَلَيْهِ أَثَرُ السَّفَرِ وَلَا يَعْرِفُهُ مِنَّا أَحَدٌ
hadiths.textEnglish: While we were sitting with the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) one day, a man came to us with very white clothes and very black hair. There was no sign of travel on him, and none of us knew him.
hadiths.context: This is the famous hadith of Gabriel where he asks the Prophet ﷺ about Islam, Iman, and Ihsan

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 1: The Book of Prayer
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "إِنَّمَا الْأَعْمَالُ بِالنِّيَّاتِ، وَإِنَّمَا لِكُلِّ امْرِئٍ مَا نَوَى"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Actions are according to intentions, and every person will have what they intended.'
hadiths.context: This hadith emphasizes the importance of having the right intention in all actions

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 2: The Excellence of Prayer
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "أَوَّلُ مَا يُحَاسَبُ بِهِ الْعَبْدُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ الصَّلَاةُ، فَإِنْ صَلُحَتْ صَلُحَ سَائِرُ عَمَلِهِ، وَإِنْ فَسَدَتْ فَسَدَ سَائِرُ عَمَلِهِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'The first thing for which a person will be brought to account on the Day of Resurrection is prayer. If it is good, then all his deeds will be good, and if it is bad, then all his deeds will be bad.'
hadiths.context: This hadith shows the importance of prayer in determining the fate of all other deeds

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 1: The Book of Fasting
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ صَامَ رَمَضَانَ إِيمَانًا وَاحْتِسَابًا غُفِرَ لَهُ مَا تَقَدَّمَ مِنْ ذَنْبِهِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever fasts Ramadan out of faith and in the hope of reward, his previous sins will be forgiven.'
hadiths.context: This hadith describes the spiritual benefits of fasting in Ramadan

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 1: The Book of Zakah
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ آتَى زَكَاةَ مَالِهِ طَاهِرَةً مِنْ قَلْبِهِ، فَلَا يَضُرُّهُ مَا أَخَذَ مِنْهُ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever gives zakah on his wealth with a pure heart, it will not harm him what is taken from him.'
hadiths.context: This hadith explains the spiritual benefits of giving zakah with sincerity

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 1: The Book of Hajj
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ حَجَّ فَلَمْ يَرْفُثْ وَلَمْ يَفْسُقْ رَجَعَ كَيَوْمِ وَلَدَتْهُ أُمُّهُ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever performs Hajj and does not commit any obscenity or transgression, he will return as if he were born anew.'
hadiths.context: This hadith describes the spiritual purification achieved through proper Hajj

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 1: The Book of Marriage
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "إِذَا خَطَبَ أَحَدُكُمْ الْمَرْأَةَ فَإِنْ اسْتَطَاعَ أَنْ يَنْظُرَ إِلَى مَا يَدْعُوهُ إِلَى نِكَاحِهَا فَلْيَفْعَلْ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'When one of you proposes to a woman, if he can look at what invites him to marry her, then let him do so.'
hadiths.context: This hadith provides guidance on marriage proposals and getting to know one's potential spouse

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 1: The Book of Virtues
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ فَلْيَقُلْ خَيْرًا أَوْ لِيَصْمُتْ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should speak good or remain silent.'
hadiths.context: This hadith teaches the importance of controlling one's speech and speaking only good words

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 1: The Book of Knowledge
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ سَلَكَ طَرِيقًا يَلْتَمِسُ فِيهِ عِلْمًا سَهَّلَ اللَّهُ لَهُ بِهِ طَرِيقًا إِلَى الْجَنَّةِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever travels a path seeking knowledge, Allah will make easy for him a path to Paradise.'
hadiths.context: This hadith emphasizes the great reward for seeking knowledge

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 1: The Book of Remembrance
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ قَالَ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، فِي يَوْمٍ مِائَةَ مَرَّةٍ، كَانَتْ لَهُ عَدْلَ عَشْرِ رِقَابٍ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever says "There is no god but Allah alone, with no partner. To Him belongs the dominion and to Him belongs all praise, and He is over all things competent" one hundred times in a day, it will be equal to freeing ten slaves.'
hadiths.context: This hadith describes the great reward for regular remembrance of Allah

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 3: The Excellence of Congregational Prayer
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "صَلَاةُ الْجَمَاعَةِ أَفْضَلُ مِنْ صَلَاةِ الْفَذِّ بِسَبْعٍ وَعِشْرِينَ دَرَجَةً"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Congregational prayer is twenty-seven times better than individual prayer.'
hadiths.context: This hadith emphasizes the great reward of praying in congregation

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 2: The Excellence of Fasting
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "الصِّيَامُ جُنَّةٌ مِنَ النَّارِ كَجُنَّةِ أَحَدِكُمْ مِنَ الْقِتَالِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Fasting is a shield from the Fire, just like the shield of one of you in battle.'
hadiths.context: This hadith describes fasting as protection from the Hellfire

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 1: The Book of Manners
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "لَا يُؤْمِنُ أَحَدُكُمْ حَتَّى يُحِبَّ لِأَخِيهِ مَا يُحِبُّ لِنَفْسِهِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'None of you will have faith until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself.'
hadiths.context: This hadith teaches the importance of loving others as we love ourselves

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 2: The Excellence of Teaching Knowledge
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "إِذَا مَاتَ الْإِنْسَانُ انْقَطَعَ عَنْهُ عَمَلُهُ إِلَّا مِنْ ثَلَاثَةٍ: إِلَّا مِنْ صَدَقَةٍ جَارِيَةٍ، أَوْ عِلْمٍ يُنْتَفَعُ بِهِ، أَوْ وَلَدٍ صَالِحٍ يَدْعُو لَهُ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'When a person dies, his deeds come to an end except for three: ongoing charity, knowledge that is beneficial, or a righteous child who prays for him.'
hadiths.context: This hadith explains what continues to benefit a person after death

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 4: The Excellence of Night Prayer
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "أَفْضَلُ الصَّلَاةِ بَعْدَ الْفَرِيضَةِ صَلَاةُ اللَّيْلِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'The best prayer after the obligatory prayers is the night prayer.'
hadiths.context: This hadith highlights the excellence of voluntary night prayers

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 2: The Excellence of Good Character
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَا مِنْ شَيْءٍ أَثْقَلُ فِي الْمِيزَانِ مِنْ حُسْنِ الْخُلُقِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Nothing is heavier on the scale than good character.'
hadiths.context: This hadith emphasizes the importance of good character in the Hereafter

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 2: The Excellence of Remembrance
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَثَلُ الَّذِي يَذْكُرُ رَبَّهُ وَالَّذِي لَا يَذْكُرُ رَبَّهُ مَثَلُ الْحَيِّ وَالْمَيِّتِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'The example of one who remembers his Lord and one who does not remember his Lord is like that of the living and the dead.'
hadiths.context: This hadith illustrates the importance of remembering Allah

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 2: The Excellence of Visiting the Sick
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "حَقُّ الْمُسْلِمِ عَلَى الْمُسْلِمِ سِتٌّ: إِذَا لَقِيْتَهُ فَسَلِّمْ عَلَيْهِ، وَإِذَا دَعَاكَ فَأَجِبْهُ، وَإِذَا اسْتَنْصَحَكَ فَانْصَحْهُ، وَإِذَا عَطَسَ فَحَمِدَ اللَّهَ فَسَمِّتْهُ، وَإِذَا مَرِضَ فَعُدْهُ، وَإِذَا مَاتَ فَاتَّبِعْهُ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'A Muslim has six rights over another Muslim: when you meet him, greet him; when he invites you, accept his invitation; when he seeks your advice, give him advice; when he sneezes and praises Allah, respond to him; when he is sick, visit him; and when he dies, follow his funeral.'
hadiths.context: This hadith outlines the mutual rights and responsibilities between Muslims

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 3: The Excellence of Fasting on Mondays and Thursdays
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "تُعْرَضُ الْأَعْمَالُ يَوْمَ الِاثْنَيْنِ وَالْخَمِيسِ، فَأُحِبُّ أَنْ يُعْرَضَ عَمَلِي وَأَنَا صَائِمٌ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Deeds are presented on Mondays and Thursdays, and I love for my deeds to be presented while I am fasting.'
hadiths.context: This hadith explains why the Prophet ﷺ fasted on Mondays and Thursdays

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 3: The Excellence of Smiling
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "تَبَسُّمُكَ فِي وَجْهِ أَخِيكَ لَكَ صَدَقَةٌ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Your smiling in your brother's face is charity for you.'
hadiths.context: This hadith shows how simple acts of kindness are considered charity

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 5: The excellence of the Friday prayer
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنِ اغْتَسَلَ يَوْمَ الْجُمُعَةِ غُسْلَ الْجَنَابَةِ ثُمَّ رَاحَ فَكَأَنَّمَا قَرَّبَ بَدَنَةً، وَمَنْ رَاحَ فِي السَّاعَةِ الثَّانِيَةِ فَكَأَنَّمَا قَرَّبَ بَقَرَةً"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever takes a bath on Friday like the bath for ceremonial purity, then goes to the mosque, it is as if he offered a camel in sacrifice; and whoever goes in the second hour, it is as if he offered a cow.'
hadiths.context: This hadith describes the great reward for attending Friday prayer early

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 3: The excellence of seeking knowledge
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ خَرَجَ فِي طَلَبِ الْعِلْمِ فَهُوَ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ حَتَّى يَرْجِعَ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever goes out in search of knowledge is in the path of Allah until he returns.'
hadiths.context: This hadith shows that seeking knowledge is considered a form of jihad

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 3: The excellence of truthfulness
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "إِنَّ الصِّدْقَ يَهْدِي إِلَى الْبِرِّ، وَإِنَّ الْبِرَّ يَهْدِي إِلَى الْجَنَّةِ، وَإِنَّ الرَّجُلَ لَيَصْدُقُ حَتَّى يُكْتَبَ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ صِدِّيقًا"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Truthfulness leads to righteousness, and righteousness leads to Paradise. A person continues to be truthful until he is recorded with Allah as truthful.'
hadiths.context: This hadith emphasizes the importance of truthfulness and its spiritual benefits

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 6: The excellence of the dawn prayer
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ صَلَّى الصُّبْحَ فِي جَمَاعَةٍ فَكَأَنَّمَا صَلَّى اللَّيْلَ كُلَّهُ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever prays the dawn prayer in congregation, it is as if he prayed the entire night.'
hadiths.context: This hadith emphasizes the special reward of the dawn prayer in congregation

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 4: The excellence of fasting six days in Shawwal
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ صَامَ رَمَضَانَ ثُمَّ أَتْبَعَهُ سِتًّا مِنْ شَوَّالٍ كَانَ كَصِيَامِ الدَّهْرِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever fasts Ramadan and then follows it with six days of Shawwal, it will be as if he fasted the entire year.'
hadiths.context: This hadith describes the reward for fasting six days after Ramadan

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 4: The excellence of good treatment of parents
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "رَغِمَ أَنْفُ رَجُلٍ أَدْرَكَ عِنْدَهُ أَبَوَاهُ الْكِبَرَ فَلَمْ يُدْخِلَاهُ الْجَنَّةَ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'May his nose be rubbed in dust - a man whose parents reach old age in his presence and they do not cause him to enter Paradise.'
hadiths.context: This hadith emphasizes the importance of treating parents well

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 7: The excellence of the two rak'ahs before Fajr
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "رَكْعَتَا الْفَجْرِ خَيْرٌ مِنَ الدُّنْيَا وَمَا فِيهَا"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'The two rak'ahs before Fajr are better than the world and everything in it.'
hadiths.context: This hadith shows the immense value of the two sunnah rak'ahs before Fajr

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 5: The excellence of good treatment of neighbors
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ فَلَا يُؤْذِي جَارَهُ، وَمَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ فَلْيُكْرِمْ ضَيْفَهُ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should not harm his neighbor, and whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should honor his guest.'
hadiths.context: This hadith teaches proper treatment of neighbors and guests

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 4: The excellence of teaching others
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ دَعَا إِلَى هُدًى كَانَ لَهُ مِنَ الْأَجْرِ مِثْلُ أُجُورِ مَنْ تَبِعَهُ لَا يَنْقُصُ ذَلِكَ مِنْ أُجُورِهِمْ شَيْئًا"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever calls to guidance will have a reward like that of those who follow him, without that diminishing their rewards in the slightest.'
hadiths.context: This hadith describes the great reward for calling others to guidance

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 3: The excellence of morning and evening remembrance
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ قَالَ حِينَ يُصْبِحُ وَحِينَ يُمْسِي: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ مِائَةَ مَرَّةٍ، لَمْ يَأْتِ أَحَدٌ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ بِأَفْضَلَ مِمَّا جَاءَ بِهِ إِلَّا رَجُلٌ قَالَ مِثْلَ مَا قَالَ أَوْ زَادَ عَلَيْهِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever says in the morning and evening: Subhan Allah wa bihamdihi (Glory be to Allah and praise be to Him) one hundred times, no one will come on the Day of Resurrection with anything better than what he has brought, except a man who said the same as he said or added to it.'
hadiths.context: This hadith describes the great reward for regular morning and evening remembrance

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 4: The excellence of morning and evening remembrance
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ قَالَ حِينَ يُصْبِحُ: أَصْبَحْنَا وَأَصْبَحَ الْمُلْكُ لِلَّهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ، لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، كَانَ لَهُ عَدْلَ رَقَبَةٍ مِنْ وَلَدِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ، وَكُتِبَتْ لَهُ عَشْرُ حَسَنَاتٍ، وَمُحِيَتْ عَنْهُ عَشْرُ سَيِّئَاتٍ، وَرُفِعَتْ لَهُ عَشْرُ دَرَجَاتٍ، وَكَانَ فِي حِرْزٍ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ حَتَّى يُمْسِيَ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever says in the morning: We have reached the morning and the dominion belongs to Allah, and all praise is for Allah. There is no god but Allah alone, with no partner. To Him belongs the dominion and to Him belongs all praise, and He is over all things competent - it will be equal to freeing a slave from the children of Ishmael, and ten good deeds will be written for him, and ten bad deeds will be erased from him, and ten degrees will be raised for him, and he will be protected from Satan until evening.'
hadiths.context: This hadith describes the great reward for morning remembrance

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 5: The excellence of seeking refuge before sleeping
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ قَالَ حِينَ يَأْوِي إِلَى فِرَاشِهِ: أَعُوذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللَّهِ التَّامَّاتِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ، لَمْ يَضُرَّهُ شَيْءٌ حَتَّى يُصْبِحَ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever says when he goes to his bed: I seek refuge in the perfect words of Allah from the evil of what He has created, nothing will harm him until morning.'
hadiths.context: This hadith describes the protection gained from seeking refuge before sleeping

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 8: The excellence of remembrance after prayer
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ سَبَّحَ اللَّهَ فِي دُبُرِ كُلِّ صَلَاةٍ ثَلَاثًا وَثَلَاثِينَ، وَحَمِدَ اللَّهَ ثَلَاثًا وَثَلَاثِينَ، وَكَبَّرَ اللَّهَ ثَلَاثًا وَثَلَاثِينَ، فَتِلْكَ تِسْعَةٌ وَتِسْعُونَ، وَقَالَ تَمَامَ الْمِائَةِ: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، غُفِرَتْ خَطَايَاهُ وَإِنْ كَانَتْ مِثْلَ زَبَدِ الْبَحْرِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever glorifies Allah thirty-three times after each prayer, and praises Allah thirty-three times, and magnifies Allah thirty-three times, that is ninety-nine, and says to complete the hundred: There is no god but Allah alone, with no partner. To Him belongs the dominion and to Him belongs all praise, and He is over all things competent - his sins will be forgiven even if they are like the foam of the sea.'
hadiths.context: This hadith describes the great reward for dhikr after prayer
